Welcome to homework_14’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database is configured correctly. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If there are no results, then we know something went wrong with our configuration.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

main.index()¶

The index function is a simple example of how to use the Flask-RESTful extension. It returns a dictionary with the key ‘message’ and value ‘Contacts’.

Returns:

A dictionary

async main.limit_access_by_ip(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The limit_access_by_ip function is a middleware function that limits access to the API by IP address. It checks if the client’s IP address is in ALLOWED_IPS, and if not, returns a 403 Forbidden response.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Access the request object

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the next function in the pipeline to this middleware

Returns:

A jsonresponse object if the ip address is not allowed

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are used by the app, such as databases or caches.

Returns:

A list of functions to be run after startup

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, current_user)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the data that is passed in

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • current_user – Get the user_id from the current logged in user

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify which contact to delete

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – Ensure that the user is only deleting their own contacts

Returns:

The deleted contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

The get_contact function is used to retrieve a single contact from the database. It takes in an integer representing the id of the contact, and returns a Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to use

  • current_user – User: Check that the user is authorized to access this contact

Returns:

A contact object or none

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the first row to return

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session object

  • current_user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

async src.repository.contacts.search_contact(search_string: str, db: AsyncSession, current_user: User)¶

The search_contact function takes in a search string, an async database session, and the current user. It then creates a SQLAlchemy statement that searches for contacts with firstname, lastname or email matching the search string. The function returns all of these contacts.

Parameters:

  • search_string – str: Search for a string in the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Filter the results to only show contacts that belong to the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search string

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts_bday(current_user: User, db: AsyncSession, days)¶
The search_contacts_bday function searches for contacts with birthdays within a given number of days.
Args:

current_user (User): The user who is currently logged in. db (AsyncSession): An async session to the database. days (int): The number of days from today to search for birthdays in.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Filter the contacts by user_id

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • days – Determine how many days in the future we want to search for birthdays

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays in the next x days

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, current_user)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactSchema): A ContactSchema object containing all fields for a new Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id of the contact we want to update

  • body – ContactSchema: Pass the data from the request body into this function

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – Check if the user is authorized to update a contact

Returns:

A contact object

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to confirm

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database connection

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession)¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database session

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email address of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A user object or none

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Get the user from the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is being passed into the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Specify that the token parameter can either be a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, we raise an HTTPException with a 400 status code (Bad Request) and detail message of &quot;Verification error&quot;.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed or a message that the email has been confirmed

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token_type

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes in a refresh token and returns a new access token. The function first decodes the refresh_token to get the email of the user who owns it, then gets that user from our database. If we find that this user’s stored refresh_token does not match what was passed in, we update their stored tokens with None (logging them out) and raise an error saying &quot;Invalid Refresh Token&quot;. Otherwise, we create new tokens for this user using auth_service functions and store them in our database before returning them.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the access token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the credentials from the request header :return: A dict with the access token and refresh token

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send a confirmation email to the user. It takes in an email address, and if that address exists in the database, it sends an email with a link for confirming their account. If they are already confirmed, it returns an error message.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Validate the request body against the requestemail schema

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the user’s email from the database :return: A dictionary with a message

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the user id from the path :return: A userschema object, which is a pydantic model

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the user from the database

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: The deleted contact

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function returns a contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url path

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned to 500

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user from the database

:param : Get the contact id from the path :return: A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.search_contact(search_string: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search_contact function searches for a contact in the database.

It takes a search_string as an argument and returns the first contact that matches it.

Parameters:

  • search_string – str: Search for a contact in the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

:param : Get the contact id :return: A single contact

async src.routes.contacts.search_contact_bday(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search_contact_bday function searches for contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.
Args:

db (AsyncSession): The database session to use. Defaults to Depends(get_db). current_user (User): The user making the request. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

:param : Get the current user :return: A list of contacts that have a birthday in the next 7 days

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: A contact

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be injected into the

get_current_user endpoint. It uses the auth_service to retrieve the current user, and returns it if found.

Parameters:

user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user, if the user is authenticated

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file that will be uploaded to Cloudinary. It also takes in a User object, which is obtained from Depends(auth_service.get_current_user). This User object represents the current user who has logged into our application and wants to update their avatar image. Finally, it also takes in an AsyncSession object (which we get from Depends(get_db)), so that we can use this session for database operations.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Connect to the database

:param : Get the current user :return: The updated user

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '1234567890'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds, the token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the attributes and methods of the class in python

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

An encoded access token

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which uses the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM to create an encoded string. The data dictionary contains information about the user’s email address, as well as when it was issued (iat) and when it expires (exp). The iat and exp values are added to the data dict before encoding.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into a jwt

Returns:

A token that contains the user’s email address and a timestamp

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The time in seconds until the token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id, username and email

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the refresh token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It will raise an exception if the token is invalid or has expired. If it’s valid, it returns the email address of the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to be decoded

Returns:

The email address of the user

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user object if it exists, otherwise it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

The user object associated with the token

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses PyJWT to decode the token, which is then used to retrieve the email address from its payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token that was sent to the user’s email address

Returns:

The email from the token

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass the password to be hashed

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is being checked

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password to the plain text password

Returns:

A boolean value

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their account.
The function takes in three parameters:

  • email: EmailStr, the user’s email address.

  • username: str, the username of the new account being created.

  • host: str, this is used for creating a link that will be sent in an email to verify

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Display the username in the email

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server

Returns:

A coroutine object
